data.meta_site_name: City of Oregon, Ohio - City of Opportunity
data.text:
The City of Oregon offers a balance of unique lakefront living, recreational opportunities, and excellent City services for residents. Beautiful residential homes in safe neighborhoods are located near cycling paths and leisure trails that provide quick access to Maumee Bay State Park as well as Pearson Metropark. Also, low tax and utility rates help to keep living affordable for residents to live, build, and grow in Oregon, Ohio!

Steve Hornyak was born in Oregon, and has been a lifelong resident in our community. Mr. Hornyak resides in Oregon with his wife, Amanda and his 3 daughters, Chelsea, Megan and Olivia. Mr. Hornyak works as the Entrance Division Manager at Oldcastle Building Envelope in Perrysburg. He is a graduate of Siena Heights University with a BA in Business Management. Mr. Hornyak has served as a School Board member for Oregon City Schools, and is a volunteer coach and umpire in NW Ohio. He has been a business owner in Oregon for over 20 years.

Email: Hornyak.travel@gmail.com

Mrs. Pollauf is now serving her third full term on council. In 2011, she served for a short time after another councilman resigned. Since that time she served on the Oregon Board of Zoning Appeals.

Kathleen is the sole proprietor of Kathleen Pollauf, LMT – Massage Therapy LLC, in Oregon. She is married to Terrence and they have 2 children, Heather and Stephen.

Email: kpollauf@oregonohio.org

Paul R. Drake Ill is serving his first term on City Council. Paul has lived in Oregon his entire life. Paul is married with one son. He is a Clay High School graduate, class of 1987. Paul has been involved with Special Olympics Softball for many years, with local, State, National, and World Games. Paul just recently retired from the City of Oregon, Public Service Department.

Email: pdrake@oregonohio.org

Dennis Walendzak is serving his fifth term on Oregon City Council. Dennis was born and raised in Oregon, Ohio and is married to Chris and they have two children, Alyson and Carter. Dennis is a 1990 graduate of Clay High School and attended the University of Findlay and Miami University. Dennis is an environmental consultant and waste broker for Environmental Management Services, and he is a member of the Oregonian Club.

Email: dwalendzak@oregonohio.org

Mrs. Ackerman is serving her first term on Oregon City Council. She graduated from Whitmer H.S. and married Kurt Ackerman in 1982. Together they have raised four children in Oregon and have 2 grandchildren. Beth helps her husband on their family farm.

Email: backerman@oregonohio.org

Steven R Salander is serving his first term on City Council. Steve is a proud father of Izzy and bonus father of Tyler and Lindsay. Steve has been active in the community and co-founder of the service group, Be the Solution Lucas County. He is also an advocate for Voices 4 Victims. Steve has a bachelor’s degree in business from The University of Toledo and currently works in banking.

Email: SSalander@Oregonohio.org
